definition: to stay/to stop/to tease (play with)/amusing/short pause in reading aloud, equivalent to comma (also written 讀|读[dou4])
to walk (side part of split character)
to provoke/to entice/to lure/to tantalize/to tease/to titillate
to amuse oneself/to clown around/to provoke laughter
to amuse/to make sb laugh/to tease
to tease/to provoke/to play with (a child, animal etc)
funny man (lead role in comic dialogue 對口相聲|对口相声[dui4 kou3 xiang4 sheng1])/to joke/to play the fool/to provoke laughter

sentences.english: The night watchman brought the armchair for Hewson. He tried to make him laugh.
sentences.chinese: 守夜人给休森搬来了一张椅子，顺便逗一下他。

sentences.english: Sam bought Nancy some flowers to cheer her up.
sentences.chinese: 山姆买了一些花给南西，好逗她开心。

sentences.english: Yeah, she's so funny. She says'yes'no matter what.
sentences.chinese: 她还真逗，不管什么时候她都说‘是’。

sentences.english: He made faces at the baby to make it laugh.
sentences.chinese: 他向婴儿做鬼脸来逗他发笑。

sentences.english: The boys teased the dog by pebbling it with acorns.
sentences.chinese: 男孩子们用橡树果打狗逗它玩。

sentences.english: It is very dangerous to play in the street.
sentences.chinese: 在马路上厮闹打逗是很危险的。

sentences.english: Michael tries to cheer her up, but is unable to make her smile.
sentences.chinese: Michael试图逗她开心，但是未能博她一笑。

sentences.english: This is really ridiculous! How could this bogus news appear in the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 这事的确够逗的，这么一条假消息竟能登在报纸上。

sentences.english: Second, no running in hallway and classrooms.
sentences.chinese: 在楼道和教室里不要追跑打逗。

sentences.english: Our hilarious Ant-Man had a funny fight with Falcon.
sentences.chinese: 猎鹰和我们新任的逗逼蚁人在这里有了场搞笑的对决。

sentences.english: This is similar in the way that we incite others to laughter by doing something comical or telling a funny joke.
sentences.chinese: 这就像我们做滑稽动作或开玩笑逗别人开心一样。

sentences.english: An upstart like that dares to bandy words with me!
sentences.chinese: 这样一个小财主也敢跟我逗嘴皮子。

sentences.english: I might buy one for a friend's birthday as a giggle.
sentences.chinese: 我可能会买一件送给朋友当生日礼物，逗他开心。

sentences.english: Jane made up stories to amuse her little brother .
sentences.chinese: 简编故事逗她的小弟弟。

sentences.english: How much is that doggie in the window? The one with the wabbly tail.
sentences.chinese: 看橱窗里有着一条小狗，它摇头摆尾可真逗。

definition: to amuse oneself/to clown around/to provoke laughter
to amuse/to make sb laugh/to tease
to show off/to put on a show to amuse others
to tease/to provoke/to play with (a child, animal etc)
to play/to have fun/to hang out
to amuse/to make sb laugh/to tease
to sway to and fro/to rock back and forth
roar of laughter (onom.)/hubbub/to roar (as a crowd)
